metadata.title: CVE-2018-12911 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
WebKitGTK+ 2.20.3 has an off-by-one error, with a resultant out-of-boundswrite, in the get_simple_globs functions inThirdParty/xdgmime/src/xdgmimecache.c andThirdParty/xdgmime/src/xdgmimeglob.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.20.5-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.20.5-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-5.0 - 2.20.5-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.20.5-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.20.5-1
gir1.2-webkit2-5.0 - 2.20.5-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.20.5-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.20.5-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.20.5-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-5.0-0 - 2.20.5-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.20.5-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.20.5-1
libwebkit2gtk-5.0-0 - 2.20.5-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.20.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.5-1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
